           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1301180%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2900" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1301180%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2900%252526ust%25253D1703406785530655%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw2taJ0CTe3sHHBxLXuEp0xi%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      Peace Be Upon You<span class="line"><!---->Peace Be Upon You<!----></span><br><br>Bypass Apk Warning In Chrome Andriod <span class="line"><!---->Bypass Apk Warning In Chrome Andriod <!----></span><br>Using A Basic Html/Js Code <span class="line"><!---->Using A Basic Html/Js Code <!----></span><br>Please Check The Code<span class="line"><!---->Please Check The Code<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [93.0.4577.82]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [93.0.4577.82]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Andriod]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Andriod]<!----></span><br><br>if you have any questions let me know<span class="line"><!---->if you have any questions let me know<!----></span><br><br>Thank You<span class="line"><!---->Thank You<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<!----></span><br>determination.<span class="line"><!---->determination.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1301180<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301180"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.

        for LitElement.

          <div class="edit-actions">

              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized" disabled="">
              Convert issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </chops-dialog>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <h1>
            
            Issue 1301180: Security:  Bypass Apk Warning In Andriod
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1301180: Security:  Bypass Apk Warning In Andriod
          </h1>

        I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful. So I don't see a bypass.<span class="line"><!---->I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful. So I don't see a bypass.<!----></span><br><br>Can you clarify the steps, or explain where the bypass is?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify the steps, or explain where the bypass is?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 7, 2022, 11:43 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 7, 2022, 11:43 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<!----></span><br>determination.<span class="line"><!---->determination.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1301180<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301180"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          min-height: 100%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;

          .metadata-container {

          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          min-height: 100%;

          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1301180: Security:  Bypass Apk Warning In Andriod
          </h1>

        I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful. So I don't see a bypass.<span class="line"><!---->I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful. So I don't see a bypass.<!----></span><br><br>Can you clarify the steps, or explain where the bypass is?<span class="line"><!---->Can you clarify the steps, or explain where the bypass is?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 7, 2022, 11:43 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Mar 7, 2022, 11:43 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<!----></span><br>determination.<span class="line"><!---->determination.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1301180<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301180"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          qin...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-93 Security_Severity-Medium OS-Android Pri-1

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Downloads

        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891"><!---->49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<!----></a><br>Author: Min Qin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Min Qin &lt;<!----></span>qinmin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/qinmin@chromium.org"><!---->qinmin@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Mar 17 21:11:18 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Mar 17 21:11:18 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fix an issue dangerous dialog is not shown for some apk download<span class="line"><!---->Fix an issue dangerous dialog is not shown for some apk download<!----></span><br><br>On Android Q+, download will create a different intermediate content<span class="line"><!---->On Android Q+, download will create a different intermediate content<!----></span><br>Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<!----></span><br>determination.<span class="line"><!---->determination.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1301180<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301180" title="Security:  Bypass Apk Warning In Andriod"><!---->BUG=1301180<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: Ie4561e8d0b4b3a87ec7a041f3ac71f23866fce04<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ie4561e8d0b4b3a87ec7a041f3ac71f23866fce04<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508375<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         qinmin: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->qinmin: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.
