        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after         Hello, thanks for your question, but no -- your English proficiency does not impact the VRP Reward. Reward judgements are solely made based on:<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thanks for your question, but no -- your English proficiency does not impact the VRP Reward. Reward judgements are solely made based on:<!----></span><br>- bug impact<span class="line"><!---->- bug impact<!----></span><br>- report quality (how well the report explains the issue and impact of it and how well it demonstrates potential exploitability) <span class="line"><!---->- report quality (how well the report explains the issue and impact of it and how well it demonstrates potential exploitability) <!----></span><br>- potential bonuses for exploits and analysis <span class="line"><!---->- potential bonuses for exploits and analysis <!----></span><br><br>Please see <span class="line"><!---->Please see <!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a> for our full VRP rules and policies.<span class="line"><!----> for our full VRP rules and policies.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1301180#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891"><!---->49bbefe192eabd120f9af9aa1e18ab0116cce891<!----></a><br>Author: Min Qin <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Min Qin &lt;<!----></span>qinmin@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/qinmin@chromium.org"><!---->qinmin@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Mar 17 21:11:18 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Mar 17 21:11:18 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fix an issue dangerous dialog is not shown for some apk download<span class="line"><!---->Fix an issue dangerous dialog is not shown for some apk download<!----></span><br><br>On Android Q+, download will create a different intermediate content<span class="line"><!---->On Android Q+, download will create a different intermediate content<!----></span><br>Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<!----></span><br>determination.<span class="line"><!---->determination.<!----></span><br><br>BUG=1301180<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301180" title="Security:  Bypass Apk Warning In Andriod"><!---->BUG=1301180<!----></a><br><br>Change-Id: Ie4561e8d0b4b3a87ec7a041f3ac71f23866fce04<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ie4561e8d0b4b3a87ec7a041f3ac71f23866fce04<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508375<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508375"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3508375<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Xing Liu <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Xing Liu &lt;<!----></span>xingliu@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/xingliu@chromium.org"><!---->xingliu@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         Hello, thanks for your question, but no -- your English proficiency does not impact the VRP Reward. Reward judgements are solely made based on:<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thanks for your question, but no -- your English proficiency does not impact the VRP Reward. Reward judgements are solely made based on:<!----></span><br>- bug impact<span class="line"><!---->- bug impact<!----></span><br>- report quality (how well the report explains the issue and impact of it and how well it demonstrates potential exploitability) <span class="line"><!---->- report quality (how well the report explains the issue and impact of it and how well it demonstrates potential exploitability) <!----></span><br>- potential bonuses for exploits and analysis <span class="line"><!---->- potential bonuses for exploits and analysis <!----></span><br><br>Please see <span class="line"><!---->Please see <!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a> for our full VRP rules and policies.<span class="line"><!----> for our full VRP rules and policies.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful. So I don't see a bypass.<span class="line"><!---->I tried this out on an Android device. I navigated to the test page and clicked [Open]. I got a dialog about where to save the file, followed immediately afterwards by a dialog that APKs might be harmful.         Simplified repro:<span class="line"><!---->Simplified repro:<!----></span><br><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>function Puf(uri, name) {<span class="line"><!---->function Puf(uri, name) {<!----></span><br>  var link = document.createElement("a");<span class="line"><!---->  var link = document.createElement("a");<!----></span><br>  link.download = name;<span class="line"><!---->  link.download = name;<!----></span><br>  link.href = uri;<span class="line"><!---->  link.href = uri;<!----></span><br>  link.click();<span class="line"><!---->  link.click();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>function openWin()<span class="line"><!---->function openWin()<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<span class="line"><!---->Puf("data:application/vnd.android.package-archive;base64,UGVhY2UgQmUgVXBvbiBZb3U=", "apk.puf")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br><input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/><span class="line"><!---->&lt;input type="button" onclick="openWin();" value="open"/&gt;<!----></span><br><br>The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<span class="line"><!---->The problem is that the download is called apk.puf, and doesn't trigger the dangerous download prompt, but when we actually save the file, we add the apk extension (probably because of the MIME type).<!----></span><br><br>Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<span class="line"><!---->Tagging with FoundIn-93 based on reporter's Chrome version, though the oldest I was able to test was 99.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<span class="line"><!---->This is an interesting bug. Chrome will create the filename apk.puf for the download. However, Android uses MediaStore to store all the downloads since Q. And MediaStore will change the file name when chrome creates the content URI.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

However, creating the content Uri<span class="line"><!---->Uri after target determination. However, creating the content Uri<!----></span><br>might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<span class="line"><!---->might cause the file name to change, as Android tries to correct the<!----></span><br>file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<span class="line"><!---->file name using MIME type. And the new file name may be of a dangerous<!----></span><br>type.<span class="line"><!---->type.<!----></span><br>However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<span class="line"><!---->However, the dangerous file check happens in target determination. So<!----></span><br>creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<span class="line"><!---->creating the intermediate content Uri later allows such file names to<!----></span><br>bypass dangerous file check.<span class="line"><!---->bypass dangerous file check.<!----></span><br>This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixes the issue by moving content URI creation into target<!----></span><br>determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<span class="line"><!---->determination stage, right before dangerous download check. And this<!----></span><br>will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<span class="line"><!---->will also simplify the logic in DownloadItemImpl as it now gets the<!----></span><br>target content Uri instead of an unused file path after target<span class="line"><!---->target content Uri instead of an unused file path after         qinmin: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->qinmin: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         Merge review required: M100 is already shipping to stable.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M100 is already shipping to stable.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Edit 
        <h3 id="editDialogTitle" class="medium-heading">
          Edit 
        </h3>
        <textarea id="description" class="content"></textarea>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
